hero.title: Professionalize skills engineering with ATHENA
hero.subtitle_strong: The initiative redefining training engineering standards for the coming decade.
hero.subtitle: ATHENA equips L&D departments with an unprecedentedly powerful tool to redefine training standards and augment instructional design through science and technology.

problem.title: Training engineering is at a dead end.
problem.description: Faced with accelerated skills obsolescence, artisanal methods are no longer sufficient. The gap is widening between field reality and training response.

granularity.title: Insufficient Granularity
granularity.desc: Skills are treated as monolithic blocks, ignoring fine cognitive nuances.

content_first.title: Content-First Approach
content_first.desc: Pushing existing content rather than starting from structural need analysis.

context.title: Context Disconnection
context.desc: The learner's real environment is rarely taken into account in the design.

model.title: A systemic modeling of competence.
model.desc_1: Competence is not a stable stock of knowledge. It is a dynamic of mobilization, coordination, and regulation of internal resources in the face of a given situation.
model.desc_2: Operationalization via 60 facets and 4 mastery levels allows moving from a generalist training intention to a precision engineering strategy.

cognition.title: Cognition
cognition.desc: Analysis, reasoning, decision-making, and anticipation capabilities. It enables understanding complex situations, prioritizing useful information, building action strategies, and adjusting choices when the environment evolves.

knowledge.title: Knowledge
knowledge.desc: Mobilizable declarative, procedural, and contextual knowledge. They group concepts, methods, rules, and benchmarks from experience that secure action and allow intervening relevantly in varied contexts.

conation.title: Conation
conation.desc: Factors of motivation, effort, perseverance, and foresight. It determines the intensity of engagement, the capacity to take action, to endure over time, and to stay oriented towards the objective despite difficulties.

emotion.title: Emotion
emotion.desc: Processing of emotional information, stress, and self-regulation. It influences the quality of discernment, relationships with others, and the faculty to maintain lucidity and stability in pressure situations.

sensorimotor.title: Sensori-motion
sensorimotor.desc: Fine sensory perception, coordination, and gestural precision. It translates intention into concrete execution through gesture adjustment, spatial relationship, and mastery of tools and interfaces.

analogy.title: The Chemistry of Competence
analogy.text:
A business competence (e.g., "Leadership") is not a monolithic block. It is a complex assembly, comparable to a molecule.

ATHENA acts like the Periodic Table of HR: we have isolated the 60 fundamental atoms (the facets) that compose all human intelligence.

Instead of managing vague "labels", you now manipulate the exact chemical formula of your jobs. You no longer guess: you recompose performance atom by atom.

footer.studio: Discover Tomorrow Theory, the HR innovation studio

ai.title: Augmented Engineering.
ai.description: ATHENA AI operationalizes the theoretical model without reducing its richness. AI acts as a reasoning amplifier to structure the pedagogical architecture, without ever masking the underlying complexity.

architecture.title: Composite Cognitive Architecture
architecture.desc: ATHENA does not rely on a single model, but on an orchestration of several specialized LLMs. This chain of agents collaborates sequentially to dissect the need, verify pedagogical coherence, and secure deliverables.

skills.title: ATHENA Skills
skills.desc: Analytical deconstruction of any competence into 60 facets, each evaluated on 4 distinct levels, to identify cognitive and behavioral prerequisites.

profile.title: ATHENA Profile
profile.desc: Multidimensional characterization of the learning context (17 factors) to ensure alignment between the pedagogical device and the operational reality of learners.

learn.title: ATHENA Learn
learn.desc: Reasoned assembly of pedagogical modalities, selected from 220+ indexed formats, justified by the adequacy between cognitive objectives and learning levers.

capabilities.title: New capabilities for the L&D department.
capabilities.description: Beyond tooling, ATHENA modifies training governance. The system establishes a decision-making practice based on probative data and choice traceability.

objectivation.title: Objectivation of pedagogical choices
objectivation.desc: Substitute intuition with traceable technical argumentation. ATHENA links each selected modality to an explicit pedagogical intention, correlated with the contributing facets of the competence.

modeling.title: Comparative modeling
modeling.desc: Evaluate ex-ante different training architectures. The system allows comparing several pedagogical investment scenarios according to resource and time constraints.

transparency.title: Decision transparency
transparency.desc: Explicate necessary tradeoffs. By making arbitrations visible (depth vs coverage), ATHENA qualifies the dialogue between L&D and business sponsors.

tactics.title: Tactical diversification
tactics.desc: Break with design automatisms. Indexing over 220 modalities allows mobilizing the entire pedagogical spectrum to meet the complexity of needs.

capitalization.title: Constitution of technical assets
capitalization.desc: Transform each project into an asset for the organization. Analyses and architectures are capitalized in a structured knowledge base, promoting continuous improvement of practices.

capabilities.conclusion: Towards a more explicit, cumulative, and strategic training engineering.

social_proof.title: A scientific achievement.
social_proof.desc_1: ATHENA is not an isolated experiment, but the breaking point of a research lineage. The system crystallizes over 10 years of continuous R&D on human performance modeling.
social_proof.desc_2: To demonstrate the application in the ATHENA project field, Tomorrow Theory formed a consortium in early 2025, alongside Decathlon, Crédit Mutuel Alliance Fédérale, and Bouygues. This consortium greatly accelerated the work related to ATHENA.
social_proof.recognition: ATHENA already benefits from academic recognition, with 3 research articles published in prestigious international academic journals. These articles total nearly 50,000 views in the research world, demonstrating strong interest in the ATHENA approach.

v2.title: ATHENA V2 Program.
v2.intro: Starting April 2026, phase 2 of the program will gather a restricted consortium of partners. The objective is to consolidate methodological standards and optimize design aid algorithms.

community.title: Community Project
community.desc: The consortium goes beyond the client-supplier relationship. We animate a community of L&D partners in open innovation mode: sharing best practices and professionalizing contributions to Tomorrow Theory's work.

transfer.title: Full Transfer

data_privacy.desc: Strict confidentiality of data and specific use cases for each organization. No pooling of sensitive data within the consortium.

problem.title: THE PROBLEM
problem.text: Traditional training engineering relies on intuition and manual processes that struggle to keep up with skills acceleration. The gap between field needs and training response is growing.
problem.quote: "We cannot solve our problems with the same thinking we used when we created them."

prop.title: VALUE PROPOSITION
prop.text: ATHENA is a composite artificial intelligence that structures, accelerates, and objectifies pedagogical design. It enables the shift from artisanal to precision engineering.

skills.title: ATHENA SKILLS
skills.desc: Atomic breakdown of skills into cognitive and behavioral micro-gestures for perfect targeting.

profile.title: ATHENA PROFILE
profile.desc: Multidimensional analysis (17 factors) of the target population to adapt pedagogical design.

learn.title: ATHENA LEARN
learn.desc: Multimodal recommendation engine drawing from 220+ formats to build hybrid paths.
